PLACEMENT SERVICE NEWS
Not long ago, the Placement Service instituted a project which,
when completed, will be of great assistance to all educational
broadcasters•
The purpose of this project is to establish a Personnel Class¬
ification and definite Job Descriptions for educational broadcasting.
We feel that it is necessary for us to formulate this information
before educational broadcasting reaches its maximum potential. Thus,
we will have a firm foundation upon which to rely when confronted
with the new problems expansion will bring. Also, the completion
of this project will facilitate our service to you by enabling us
to give you exactly what you want.
In connection with this, the Placement Service recently con¬
ducted a survey to determine the number and types of personnel used
by educational stations and production centers. The response to
this survey has been fairly good, but in order not to omit anyone
and to accomplish our initial purpose, we should like to have a
100^ return.
To those who have responded, we extend our grateful thanks.
To those who through an oversight have not yet returned the survey
form, we urge you to do so as soon as possible.
Our final tabulation will begin as soon as the remainder of
the survey forms are received. At that time we will have more news
about it.
